meanings.definition: Essentially different in kind; not allowing comparison.
meanings.sent1: The two sisters had disparate personalities, one quiet and the other outgoing.
meanings.sent2: The team was made up of disparate individuals, each bringing a unique skill to the table.
meanings.sent3: It was a disparate mix of colors in the painting, yet somehow it all worked together beautifully.
meanings.sent4: The music was a disparate blend of genres, creating a harmonious symphony of sound.
meanings.sent5: The disparate landscapes of the two countries left a lasting impression on the travelers.

meanings.definition: Containing or made up of fundamentally different and often incongruous elements.
meanings.sent1: The artist's sculpture was a disparate combination of metal and glass.
meanings.sent2: The novel was a disparate collection of stories from various time periods.
meanings.sent3: The room decor was a disparate mix of modern and vintage styles, creating a unique ambiance.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was a disparate ensemble of patterns and colors, making a bold fashion statement.
meanings.sent5: The play was a disparate blend of comedy and drama, keeping the audience engaged throughout.
